query: What are my rights regarding personal projects?

generation.answer:
Based on the provided context, if a personal project created by an intern meets all of the following conditions, it is considered the intern's property:
1. The project was created entirely on the intern’s own time. [ID: Intern_Inventions_and_IP_Policy_4]
2. No Company resources (including laptops or proprietary data) were utilized. [ID: Intern_Inventions_and_IP_Policy_4]
3. The project does not compete with the Company’s business interests. [ID: Intern_Inventions_and_IP_Policy_4]
If these conditions are not met, the work products, designs, code, or reports created during the internship belong to the company as stated in [ID: New_Joiner_Internship_Handbook_7] and [ID: Intern_Confidentiality_and_Acceptable_Use_Policy_5].

query: Which team will i be joining?
What are my rights regarding personal projects?
What are my rights regarding personal projects & prior inventions?

generation.answer: Your rights regarding personal projects are that they are considered your personal property only if they were created entirely on your own time, no Company resources were utilized, and the project does not compete with the Company’s business interests [ID: Intern_Inventions_and_IP_Policy_4]. For prior inventions created before the internship, you must disclose them in writing at the start of the programme to ensure they are excluded from this policy. [ID: Intern_Inventions_and_IP_Policy_4]
